Race.SummaryText:
PARISHWIDE PROPOSITION

SUMMARY:  EMERGENCY TELEPHONE SERVICE CHARGES NOT TO EXCEED (I) FIVE PERCENT (5%) OF THE TARIFF RATE FOR LOCAL TELEPHONE SERVICE SUPPLIED WITHIN THE RED RIVER PARISH COMMUNICATIONS DISTRICT (PROVIDED, HOWEVER, IF THE DISTRICT IS SERVED BY MORE THAN ONE SERVICE SUPPLIER, THEN THE CHARGE SHALL NOT EXCEED 5% OF THE HIGHEST TARIFF RATE), AND (II) 85 CENTS (85*) PER MONTH PER WIRELESS COMMERCIAL RADIO MOBILE SERVICE CONNECTION FOR THE PURPOSE OF ESTABLISHING BUILDING, EQUIPPING, MAINTAINING, OPERATING AND SUPPORTING AN ENHANCED 911 EMERGENCY TELEPHONE SYSTEM, WITH THE REVENUES DERIVED FROM SUCH EMERGENCY SERVICE CHARGE TO BE SUBJECT TO FUNDING INTO BONDS OR OTHER OBLIGATIONS AS PERMITTED BY LAW.
Race.FullText: Shall the Red River Parish Communications District (the "District"), be authorized to levy emergency telephone service charges not to exceed (i) five percent (5%) of the tariff rate for local telephone service supplied within the District (provided, however, if the District is served by more than one service supplier, then the charge shall not exceed 5% of the highest tariff rate), provided, that the service charge shall be imposed only upon the amount of the tariff rate for exchange access lines or their equivalent, that charges for telephone equipment and long distance service shall be exempt from the five percent (5%) service charge imposed herein, and that exchange access facilities in excess of one hundred per person per location shall be exempt from the five percent (5%) service charge imposed herein, and (ii) 85 cents (85*) per month per wireless commercial mobile radio service connection which enables a service user to access the 911 emergency telephone number through the use of such connection, said charges to be levied from such effective date as maybe established by the governing authority of the District, for the purpose of establishing, building, equipping, maintaining, operating and supporting an enhanced 911 emergency telephone system, all as provided by R.S. 33:9101 to 9109, inclusive, of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended, with the revenues derived from such emergency service charge to be subject to funding into bonds or other obligations as permitted by law?
